title: GNIP subdomain take over

profile.name: Twitter
profile.about: Twitter helps you create and share ideas and information instantly, without barriers.

vulnerability_information:
Hello,
Your subdomain at blog.gnipcentral.com is not well configured with allows subdomain take over as @fransoren explained in report #145224 .

PoC:
Go to http://blog.gnipcentral.com/ , you will be redirected to my domain http://testcloudfrontbug.s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/asd/index.html 


Please for more information visit the report made by @fransorosen, it's explained with all details possible.

Thanks,
Hussein
vulnerability_information_html:

activities.message:
Thanks for your report, @hussein98d. We're looking into this and we'll be sure to update you as soon as we have more information. Regarding your exploit, since this is something that's publicly available to any user that views the site, we would appreciate a more subtle approach when proving subdomain takeover; in future proof of concepts. Such as an HTML comment in page's source code that says; `<!-- Hello from hussein98d -->`. 

Thanks for thinking of Twitter security.

Thanks for thinking of Twitter security.

activities.message:
No problem. I will do that the next time. Can you please triag the report?

Thanks

activities.message:
Thank you for your report. We believe it may be a valid security issue and will investigate it further. It could take some time to find and update the root cause for an issue, so we thank you for your patience.

Thank you for helping keep Twitter secure!

activities.message: Thank you for bringing this issue to our attention. Unfortunately, this report does not fall in scope for a monetary reward at this time. However, you will still be listed in our Hall of Fame. Thanks again.
activities.markdown_message: Thank you for bringing this issue to our attention. Unfortunately, this report does not fall in scope for a monetary reward at this time. However, you will still be listed in our Hall of Fame. Thanks again.

activities.message: Hi @rajat_tw @twitter , I don't understand why this report is not eligible for a reward. I already reported multiple bugs on Twitter acquisitons and I always receivied somehow a reward. I also saw many  many dislcosed reports where researchers reported bugs to you regarding your acquisitions. I believe this vulnerability could have led to much bad things, and I hope you take another look at this.
activities.markdown_message: Hi @rajat_tw @twitter , I don't understand why this report is not eligible for a reward. I already reported multiple bugs on Twitter acquisitons and I always receivied somehow a reward. I also saw many many dislcosed reports where researchers reported bugs to you regarding your acquisitions. I believe this vulnerability could have led to much bad things, and I hope you take another look at this.

activities.message:
Hi @hussein98d, 

Thanks for being an active member of the Twitter Bug Bounty program, we really appreciate it. The scope of domains in this program are listed on this [page](https://hackerone.com/twitter). On occasions when we get a report about an acquisition not listed on the page, depending on the impact of the bug and our discretion , we make an exception in that case. As this bug is on a domain out of scope it is not eligible for a reward. 

Thanks again for your efforts.

activities.message: @rajat_tw so you think that a subdomain takeover is not enough dangerous?

activities.message:
Twitter acquisition reports about subdomain take over which were rewarded:
https://hackerone.com/reports/42236
https://hackerone.com/reports/32825 ( at the time reported, VINE was not yet in scope )
activities.markdown_message:
Twitter acquisition reports about subdomain take over which were rewarded:
https://hackerone.com/reports/42236
https://hackerone.com/reports/32825 ( at the time reported, VINE was not yet in scope )

activities.message:
Hi @hussein98d,

I appreciate you being passionate about security. As I mentioned above the in-scope domains are mentioned clearly on the guidelines page, anything outside that is at our discretion. We like to be fair to everyone and from the report from two years ago that you mentioned in the comments states the same stand we take "any reported issues on out-of-scope domains are typically just a thanks in our hall-of-fame, but we decided to make an exception and pay here because of the severity of the issue." I would not like to go in-depth in our evaluation of the severity and other factors that we consider, as it is internal information. Gnip is not in the domains mentioned and is out of scope.

Again, thanks for being part of the program.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @hussein98d,

I appreciate you being passionate about security. As I mentioned above the in-scope domains are mentioned clearly on the guidelines page, anything outside that is at our discretion. We like to be fair to everyone and from the report from two years ago that you mentioned in the comments states the same stand we take "any reported issues on out-of-scope domains are typically just a thanks in our hall-of-fame, but we decided to make an exception and pay here because of the severity of the issue." I would not like to go in-depth in our evaluation of the severity and other factors that we consider, as it is internal information. Gnip is not in the domains mentioned and is out of scope.

Again, thanks for being part of the program.

activities.message:
As always I accept your decision even if I think it's not the best way to deal with researchers. I think that a program like Twitter should not do stuff like that . We , researchers, are always glad to help but behind that comes money which is one of our preoccupation  (at least for me ) , to not be lying. Requesting public disclosure so other researchers looking for bounties only don't waste their time digging for 3 hours on this domain. 

Thank you,
Hussein

summaries.content: Already received bounties from Twitter for bugs in acquisitions. But not this time because Twitter guys judge this subdomain take over to not be enough critical. Read the full report in case you need my point of view on this.
